document_title: Joint stiffness: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
When experiencing symptoms of stiff joints, the patient will find it difficult to move. This condition may become more severe and last longer as the level of arthritis progresses. Short-term stiffness in the knee or hip joint appears after sitting for several hours, making it difficult for the patient to walk. Below are some causes of dryness in the joints: (2)
1. Rheumatoid arthritis
Rheumatoid arthritis is a common arthritis, appearing more in women than in men, between the ages of 30 and 50. This is an autoimmune disorder that causes the immune system to attack healthy joints.
2. Ankylosing spondylitis
Ankylosing spondylitis has the most characteristic manifestations of calcification of the bone bridge between the vertebrae and sacroiliac joint fusion, causing the spine to lose mobility. Common symptoms are pain and stiffness in the hips and lower back, especially after waking up or after a period of inactivity.
3. Osteoarthritis
Osteoarthritis is a degenerative form of arthritis caused by joint wear and tear. Some common types of degeneration:
Hip osteoarthritis; Degenerative Knee; Shoulder osteoarthritis; …
4. Bursitis
Bursitis is a condition in which the synovial joints become inflamed, the synovial membrane thickens and progresses. This inflammation can cause pain and stiffness. Bursitis can occur in almost any joint but is most common in larger joints such as the shoulder, hip, and knee.
5. Bone cancer
Although this is a rare cause, it is entirely possible. Patients with bone cancer often experience  joint pain, bone pain and reduced joint mobility.
6. Gout
Gout is an arthritis disease related to protein metabolism disorders in the body. The disease often has a sudden onset and tends to affect men more often than women. The disease progresses quickly, symptoms sometimes appear overnight, usually in the big toe with signs of stiffness, swelling, heat, redness, and pain of the joints.
7. Lupus erythematosus
Another autoimmune disease that causes the immune system to attack healthy tissues such as muscles and joints. When systemic lupus erythematosus attacks the joints, symptoms such as swelling, pain, etc. will appear.
8. After injury
After an injury such as a fall, too vigorous sports activities, a traffic accident, a cast or after surgery can cause damaged cartilage, dislocation, fractures, lack of movement in the joints... leading to joint pain. hard. Therefore, rehabilitation after bone and joint surgery is very necessary.
9. Aging
After many years of exercise, joints are subjected to a lot of pressure and will weaken. This condition is considered an inevitable part of aging. Along with the aging of the population, the rate of people suffering from this disease in the world has increased significantly... (1)
